ec6d0ad8-be28-4902-8162-eab02375e1a2.description: Job Overview and ResponsibilitiesSales AssociateAs one of our passionate, fun and dedicated Sales Associates, you will be the voice of our brand while elevating the consumer experience through genuine consumer connections and selling our original/innovative products. As an invaluable part of our team, you will thrive in an environment where individuality and authenticity are celebrated. If you aspire to a career in retail and are looking for a company dedicated to your personal growth to evolve into a leader of tomorrow, then Vans is for you.Join the Vans FamilyVans® is the original action sports footwear company, rooted in authenticity and creativity. Founded in 1966, we have thrived on a legacy of impacting our greater community through four pillars: action sports, music, art and street culture. We are constantly inspired by the creative voyagers within our company and community. For them, creativity is about the journey, not just the output. Our mission is to empower everyone to use creativity to discover themselves. Our vision is to create a world where anyone can be their unique self.At Vans, our culture sets us apart and influences everything we do. We are driven by our five values: We have HEART - also referred to as the “Van Doren Spirit”. We are relentlessly CURIOUS about our consumers and the world around us. We are UNAPOLOGETICALLY AUTHENTIC and wholeheartedly believe the most “Off the Wall” thing you can do is be yourself. We are driven by a spirit of INGENUITY. And we are passionate about local COMMUNITIES. And most of all, we are a family that has fun together.At Vans we empower creative exploration and inspire youth culture through a commitment to inclusivity. We welcome anyone and everyone into our global family and proudly celebrate and environment where individuality is embraced, equal opportunities thrive, and everyone is empowered to reach their greatest potential.By joining our family, you will be immersed in an environment of incredibly supportive and collaborative people. We work hard across a multitude of initiatives to bring the Van Doren Spirit to life. We live for what we do.How You Will Make a DifferenceWhat you will do:• Build sales by maintaining a consumer centric mindset and using selling behaviors through genuine interactions with consumers.• Ensure the store is consistently recovered and consumer ready by meeting brand standards.• Use strong verbal and nonverbal communication skills to exceed sales results.• Regularly interact with consumers within the store, providing a high level of customer service.• Adhere to policies, procedures and practices that align with company directives.What's in it For YouWe're in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That's why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we're the total package. Go to MyVFBenefits.com and click on “Looking to Join VF?” to learn more.Free To Be, Inclusion & DiversityAs a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.Our Parent Company, VF CorporationVF is one of the world's largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies connecting people to the lifestyles, activities and experiences they cherish through our family of iconic outdoor, active and workwear brands. At the heart of our journey lies our company-wide purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It's the reason we come to work every day. It's a commitment shared by our global associates across all brands. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.comWe just have one question. Are you in?Please note, our hiring ranges are determined and built from market pay data. Although all positions have a hiring range based upon market data, this position has a minimum starting rate that is listed above. In determining the specific compensation for this position, we comply with all local, state, and federal laws.At VF, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual's race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. If you are unable to submit your application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at peopleservices@vfc.com. VF will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law.Pursuant to all applicable local Fair Chance Ordinance requirements, including but not limited to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, VF will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
ec6d0ad8-be28-4902-8162-eab02375e1a2.title: Sales Associate
ec6d0ad8-be28-4902-8162-eab02375e1a2.companyOverview: Vans is about a state of mind. Thinking differently. Embracing creative self-expression. Authenticity and progression. Choosing your own line on your board and in your life. Vans holds 50 years of youth culture connectivity, Vans continues to advance its roots in action sports while recognizing the global 'Off the Wall' connection between the brand and art, music and street culture enthusiasts.Today, the Vans brand evolution continues- from its foundation as an original skateboarding company since '66, to a leading action sports brand, to defining its anthem of living 'Off the Wall' as youth culture. From its birthplace on the West Coast, Vans has grown beyond a shoe. It's a global movement- reaching from Barcelona to Beijing, Sao Paulo to Sydney, Orange County to New York.Vans goes to market through its network of deeply rooted wholesale partners and its direct-to-consumer platform with more than 450 owned retail stores worldwide. Given this amazing platform to connect with consumers, we're constantly looking for better and more creative ways to amplify the brand's in-store presence. And equally strong is the Vans' extraordinary e-commerce and social media presence, inclusive of its digital video platform, OffTheWall.tv. Through its various online channels, Vans has access to over 14 million brand loyalists at any given time.

ec2ed247-c6bf-4c41-8e80-cd08303825ef.companyOverview: Pandora designs, manufactures, and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores. Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 27,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 23.4 billion in 2021.

547ecedc-548a-4c4c-b72f-4b259dc0336b.description:
Job Overview and Responsibilities
The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.

The McBurney YMCA is seeking a Fitness Center Essentials Coach who will oversee the fitness areas and provide outstanding service to ensure a positive and safe user experience. They will guide beginner exercisers through the YMCA Fitness Center Essentials and provide outstanding service to ensure a positive member experience. The goal of the Fitness Center Essentials program is to assist members in making a healthy lifestyle change and to build self-esteem. Assisting members through this process by providing personalized attention, support and motivation, and education and instruction will lead to member engagement and retention.
547ecedc-548a-4c4c-b72f-4b259dc0336b.title: Fitness Center Essentials Coach
547ecedc-548a-4c4c-b72f-4b259dc0336b.companyOverview: Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches.

jobSpecificTasks: Prepare debt/equity offering memoranda for real estate transactions
Analyze rent rolls and operating statements
38eaabdb-e75d-4bfd-bb3a-4eaf25bb4216.description: **Job Overview and Responsibilities** - Prepare debt and/or equity offering memoranda for commercial real estate transactions, including gathering client and property information, section write ups, creating tables, graphs and charts, and managing the graphic design process in conjunction with graphic designer - Analyze and evaluate rent rolls and operating statements of properties being considered for financing to determine feasibility and valuation - Prepare pro forma statements and projections which accurately reflect past history of properties, as well as current and projected future market conditions - Prepare financial models in Excel and Argus for clients which outline valuation and pricing structures - Prepare discounted cash flow analyses - Research, analyze, and evaluate market feasibility for various real estate transactions - Prepare debt sizings, prepayment/defeasance calculations - Assist in collecting and evaluating required due diligence for transactions to include: make necessary inquiries to clients to ensure that required information is provided timely - Understand and review real estate documents (leases, loan documents, appraisals, etc.) to determine if any issues/inconsistencies exist - Convey all particulars of a transaction (financial projections, market and location issues and tenant analysis etc.) in formal written format for financing packages presented to clients - Generate weekly reports and updates to senior brokers on calling program status and loan quote grids - Collect lender/investor bids and maintain quote matrix, lender lists - Participate in marketing calls - Contact and respond to lender requests/questions - Assist in conducting property tours / inspections - Other duties as assigned **Qualifications and Requirements** - Bachelor’s Degree (Business, Finance, Accounting, Real Estate, etc.) preferred - Combination of education without a degree and corporate work experience may be considered - 2 to 4 years of real estate financial analysis and/or finance experience preferably with a commercial real estate firm engaged in consulting, appraisal, investing, lending, or brokerage - Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy - Ability to construct, apply and analyze complex financial models in Excel and ARGUS preferred - Strong written communication skills developing high-level analysis summaries - Passion for client delivery, with strong emphasis on producing high-quality work, meeting deadlines, and strong personal initiative to succeed in an entrepreneurial environment - Ability to function in a team-oriented setting while working independently with limited day-to-day supervision - Strong time management, organization, and interpersonal skills - Ability to handle multiple projects at one time and work in a high-volume, fast past transaction-oriented environment - Takes charge and is proactive in all aspects of role - Growth oriented mindset, desire to learn and shares knowledge to help others succeed - Ability to maintain attention to detail while working under tight deadlines - Highly proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; advance Excel skills preferred - Ability and willingness to travel and work long hours, including some weekends as needed **Pay and Benefits** The compensation for the position is: $74,375.00 - $87,500.00
38eaabdb-e75d-4bfd-bb3a-4eaf25bb4216.title: Capital Markets Financial Analyst
38eaabdb-e75d-4bfd-bb3a-4eaf25bb4216.address: 1290 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY 10104

jobSpecificTasks: Resolve billing issues and process payments
Analyze data and present operational recommendations
c303907d-e0c5-4d03-8df2-fdd2e9d3dc41.description: Job Overview and Responsibilities. Under the guidance of the Director of Finance, the PT Finance Student Account Services Assistant will be responsible for overseeing the accuracy and efficiency of all SCPS student accounts. This position is responsible for reviewing and performing audits on student accounts and finance reports. Assist in answering general email inquiries, problem solving and resolution of all issues pertaining to student billing, posting of payments, tuition remission, financial aid awards and student refunds. Duties and Responsibilities: • Assist in the daily operations of the student accounts receivable functions ensuring compliance of the School's payment and refund policies. • Responsible for analysis of student account data and preparing and presenting reports to the Director, makes operational recommendations based on data analyses. • Handle complex and varied problems, which require analysis and interpretation of account details and discretion. • Assist the Director of Finance in the billing and collections of student account receivables. • Accurately and timely processing of tuition payments; reconcile to assure student accounts are credited accordingly. Communicate with students and resolve account issues. • Assists our Finance Team in servicing students email inquiries by identifying and correcting billing issues and irregularities, inaccurate posting of payments, financial aid awards and student refunds. Escalate serious issues to the Director using professional judgment. • Responsible for posting scholarship awards, tuition remission benefits, and third-party wire and or bank transfer payments to student accounts. • Work closely with the Director of Finance to provide monthly lists of unpaid balances and to ensure these are paid off in a timely fashion. • Refer delinquent accounts to collections and collect on delinquent accounts. Responsible for placing financial holds and applying fees accordingly (i.e., Late fees). • Responsible for running a monthly trial balance report, researching and correcting all variances. • Provide customized financial reports, cost templates, and trend analysis on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis to the Finance Director and when necessary to the SCPS leadership team. • Maintain accurate student records in a professional manner and assist with retrieval and printing during annual Single Audit Report and/or as per request of the Director of Finance. • Support the Finance team and participate in special projects as needed. • Perform other job-related duties as assigned Qualifications and Requirements Education: • Bachelor's Degree preferred. Experience: • Two to four years of experience working within a higher education student account office and/or student financial aid office environment. • Customer service experience is required. Experience working with students is highly preferred Skills: • Advanced level skills in Microsoft Office Suite required (Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint); working knowledge of Ellucian Colleague and/or other student Information systems preferred. • A professional and resourceful approach; the ability to work independently and as a team player, to take initiative, and to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously; must demonstrate ability to maintain confidentiality of records and information; Ability to quickly identify and respond to wide-ranging topics, including taking steps to resolve problems effectively. • Ability to prioritize work. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively in written and oral form. Strong financial skills and knowledge of office computer applications are required. • Self-motivation and sound decision-making skills are required.

87ded484-fa37-4b37-8851-cb32ffc68e2d.description:
Job Overview and Responsibilities
 
Immigrant Social Services, Inc. (ISS) seeks a Director of Finance and Operations to join our leadership team. This role is pivotal in ensuring the financial health and operational efficiency of our organization as we expand in scope and complexity. With the support of the Executive Director, the Director of Finance and Operations will be responsible for developing, strengthening, and managing financial and administrative systems and practices that advance our mission and goals. ISS has an annual budget of approximately $1.8M and our five-level office and programs space is located in the Lower East Side, Manhattan.

The ideal candidate will possess expertise in nonprofit finance and operations, demonstrating resourcefulness and creative problem-solving skills. They will be the type of person who is willing to roll up their sleeves, appreciates the significance of both micro and macro-level strategic thinking, and thrives in a small dynamic nonprofit environment.

0e4ed92a-e30d-44b3-96bc-6ffe638c1bc1.description:
Job Overview and Responsibilities
The Financial Controller's mission is to assist 
 support the Finance department with the business and commercial sales of all departments including building business plans that are cost effective.
 
Key Responsibilities
• Control of retail activities including brick 
 mortar stores and online operations; measure, monitor, and anticipate the evolution of main business strategic drivers.
• Promote and prepare optimization plans; preparation of reports, studies, analysis, and related information to support decision-making process.
• Develop and present the Operational Budget and Forecasts with all departments of the Company.
• Analyze the evolution of business key drivers and budget deviations.
• Monthly reporting and analysis of all the activities (sales, productivity, P
L, investments).
• Promote and collaborate with all the departments in the development and implementation of projects and optimization plans to improve country activities.
• Ensure compliance with group policies and requirements.
• Collaborate and work with the different Departments during the budget process.
• Assisting with ad hoc Power point presentations.
 
Zara USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity and expression, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, citizenship status, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Qualifications and Requirements
• MBA, CPA, CMA or similar credentials
• A minimum of 5 years of experience, preferably in a similar financial position.
• Apparel Fashion Retail, logistics and e-Commerce experience is highly desirable.
• Managed an accounting department through monthly close and reporting cycles
• Experience in management reporting with expert level in Excel (including Macros)
• Advanced level of PowerBi
• Process Improvement experience including system implementations
• Fluent in English (Spanish will be a plus)
• Aptitude for figures
• Well organized and able to meet deadlines
• Aptitude for working with computers (Excel 
 Power Point must)
• Autonomy
• Demonstrated ability to successfully lead milestone driven projects
• Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
• Solid organizational and project management skills
• Ability to work in a cutting-edge, casual environment where flexibility is essential
• Must be comfortable with aggressive deadlines
• Experience in a high volume and fast paced operation
0e4ed92a-e30d-44b3-96bc-6ffe638c1bc1.title: Financial Controller
0e4ed92a-e30d-44b3-96bc-6ffe638c1bc1.companyOverview: Zara offers the latest fashion trends for women, men and children. An international brand with stores in the main cities of the world and online. Our business model is centered in our customers, constantly adapting to their needs. We love what we do. Teamwork, passion, curiosity, diversity, sustainability, creativity and humility are our daily motivation.

ac8bb4a9-f158-4516-99d0-a68e9d03f2b4.description: OUR STORY: Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what's next, never settling for what was good enough yesterday. Our audience is obsessed with reaching their goals – and we build equally obsessive teams that put our members and guests at the center of everything we do. We dream big and don't settle for the status quo. We sweat the details. We never accept less than our best. We want to turn heads – and we'll never stop until we do. We aren't just a company; we're a community vested in each other's success. We value humility and a team approach at every level of the company. If you’re looking for a place that will continually challenge you to do your best, you've found the right place. Back to Search Results Summary Job Description As an Equinox Personal Trainer your career becomes an empowered lifestyle founded on maximizing both your personal and client performance. Under the guidance of two dedicated managers you will gain the education, coaching skills and business acumen necessary to become a top performer in our industry. We will tattoo the skills and knowledge you develop into a holistic view of fitness and business that will allow you to build a sustainable career and help clients achieve their goals. Job responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: Qualified candidates must possess: To be the best, we hire the best.
ac8bb4a9-f158-4516-99d0-a68e9d03f2b4.title: Personal Trainer - Greenwich Ave. NYC
ac8bb4a9-f158-4516-99d0-a68e9d03f2b4.companyOverview: Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands.

0b9e97ab-c2e1-4738-a4c8-1587d2819241.description:
Equinox's Code is based on the highest standards of sports training that also take into account the elements of the body, mind, and soul.  They have a common bond expressed through passion, excellence and commitment to quality from the inside out. Equinox stands out among its peers in the fitness landscape for their scientifically grounded approach to fitness that is healthy and attainable. As a Pilates Instructor at our company, you will be a vital partner in our incredible growth and expansion, and have the opportunity to advance your career. Organic growth, flexibility, and dedication to evolving physicality are critical aspects of who we are and what we do both with our teams and members.

The role involves initiating, fostering, and maintaining high quality Pilates classes for members with a wealth of varying backgrounds, skill levels, and goals.
0b9e97ab-c2e1-4738-a4c8-1587d2819241.title: Pilates Instructors
0b9e97ab-c2e1-4738-a4c8-1587d2819241.companyOverview: Equinox is a global high growth collective of innovators and fitness enthusiasts, renowned for their artful facilities, development programs, and ethos of pushing boundaries.

0d1706e5-b437-41ee-9850-c71a51407f00.description: Equinox Group is a high-growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands that includes Equinox, Equinox Hotels, Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Furthermore, and Precision Run. We passionately believe that the Company’s soul is defined by how personally we infuse our values into our work and how we bring these values to life. Equinox Group is seeking Group Fitness Instructors to join our teams in Long Island. The first step in the audition process is to complete the application below and be invited to join an Audition. After submitting an application, an audition class will be scheduled for you to attend. We are looking for quality Instructors who embrace the reputation we have built. All candidates should be able to teach a variety of modalities and have standout qualifications. Back to Search ResultsKey Responsibilities: Deliver the Equinox Experience to our members Conduct private training sessions Maintain all mandatory education certifications Qualifications: Current nationally recognized Group Fitness certification 1+ years of experience teaching groups Dedicated to maintaining personal integrity and personal health Committed to being punctual and dependable Maintain a positive and professional attitude We offer competitive salary, benefits, and complimentary Equinox membership opportunities. Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at https

da23172d-954b-4fd8-a988-95bcf1c9cfb7.description:
OUR STORY:
We are a company with integrated luxury and lifestyle offerings centered on Movement, Nutrition and Regeneration. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Responsible for the quality of the Equinox experience throughout every touch point, we strive at all times to achieve excellence. This is your opportunity to build your career with a company that is known for its innovative and growth-oriented vision.

Job Description:

Manager on Duty functions as an extension of the Club Management Team (CMT) and serves to execute supervisory and administrative needs of assigned Department(s). The MOD is responsible for ensuring accurate completion of departmental related plans, tasks and maintenance. The MOD helps to manage and support overall Department operations to achieve performance metrics including success and training session/revenue targets. The MOD provides client/member/guest fitness consultations and customer service. The MOD is also required to work a full (10) hour shift on the Fitness Floor, after mandatory Club Management Meetings to support the Fitness Management Team during peak Hours.
da23172d-954b-4fd8-a988-95bcf1c9cfb7.title: Manager, Personal Training Programming and Development, Summit

0085d20c-193d-4d47-b9f1-4c82eaae2b49.description: OUR STORY Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what's next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. We have a fierce commitment to high-performance living and we continually invest in and evolve our diverse portfolio of lifestyle concepts. Please click here to learn more about our company. OUR CODE We are passionate about high performance living and we practice what we preach - investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a disruptive approach to unleash it. We dream big and don't settle for the status quo. We sweat the details. We never accept less than 110% to help each other deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what's new, what's now, what's next. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren't just a company; we're a community vested in each other's success. We value humility and a team approach at every level of the company. JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for energetic, creative, and enthusiastic Personal Trainers to join the Equinox team. This is a role for a fitness professional who is passionate about helping clients achieve health and fitness goals. Qualifications: - Must be certified in CPR/AED- Certifications from NSCA, ACSM, NASM, ACE or AFAA - Experience designing exercise programs for clients of all levels - Ability to self-promote and network - Passionate about health and fitness- Excellent communication skills and interpersonal skills Responsibilities: - Build and maintain a client base through conducting fitness assessments and demonstrating the value of personal training, including safe and proper exercise techniques. - Prepare and deliver comprehensive fitness programs based on clients' goals that include proper diet, exercise, and chronic disease management - Sell and promote training packages through in-club marketing, conducting fitness assessments, and highlighting the benefits of working one-on-one with a personal trainer - Maintain knowledge and/or participation in all club services, programs and products - Execute administrative requirements including the preparation of client evaluations and fitness profiles - Ensure all members feel competent, confident, and connected by providing superior customer service through complimentary fitness assessments and orientation sessions - Achieve or exceed monthly revenue and session goals- Other duties as assigned
0085d20c-193d-4d47-b9f1-4c82eaae2b49.title: Personal Trainer
0085d20c-193d-4d47-b9f1-4c82eaae2b49.companyOverview: Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands.

8c1f2c3a-bfe4-40b9-acf8-5d1adcec88a1.description:
OUR STORY
Equinox Group is a high-growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands that includes Equinox. We have locations in New York City, Los Angeles, Miami, and in other major cities throughout the US as well as London, Toronto, and Vancouver. Wherever we go, we deliver the highest standards of excellence in fitness with the promise of an unparalleled member experience across our clubs and extraordinary services within our hotels and workspaces.

Our code: It is not just a job, it's an honor. We all share a passion to win and a determination to succeed. We intentionally seek out clients and talent from diverse backgrounds and origins, all with unique stories and ideas. We strive to unleash the untapped potential these diverse groups bring to the Equinox culture and believe in moving together, moving fast and moving forward. Let’s make a difference for the powerful diverse community we support within our clubs and outside our doors.

JOB DESCRIPTION
We are looking for energetic, creative, and enthusiastic Personal Trainers to join the Equinox team. This is a great position for a candidate looking to make a significant impact in a growing and dynamic organization with great potential for personal and professional development.

Within the first 90 days as an Equinox personal trainer, you will receive 80 hours of paid Virtual Classroom education, four weeks of Onboarding training and two days of Personal Development continuing education. This is an opportunity to be developed into the best coach you can be. As a Personal Trainer of Equinox, you will receive full pay of $15/hour while you train, a rate unique to Equinox that will take you through your expected commissions. After completing the Select Program, Equinox will pay you $20/hour while you train.

Starting your career with Equinox will provide you with a variety of opportunities on a steady path of learning with meaningful growth and leadership opportunities.

Primary Responsibilities:
- Administer fitness evaluations
- Provide a tailored one-on-one training
- Develop safe, professional work health plans
- Educate and communicate benefits of regular exercise
- Build relationships with members and the surrounding community

Qualifications
- Current Nationally recognized Personal Training certification or 4 year Bachelor's degree
- High level knowledge of anatomical and kinesiological concepts
- Prior experience as a personal trainer
- Exemplify a strong hospitality commitment
- High school diploma or GED. College degree is preferred
- CPR/AED certification required
8c1f2c3a-bfe4-40b9-acf8-5d1adcec88a1.title: Personal Trainer
8c1f2c3a-bfe4-40b9-acf8-5d1adcec88a1.companyOverview: Equinox Group is a high-growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands that includes Equinox.

595b0983-9f68-4241-8738-71868988e821.description: JOB DESCRIPTION Equinox Fitness is seeking accomplished and passionate Personal Trainers to join our team! The Personal Trainer's role is to deliver a world-class fitness experience to Equinox members. As a Personal Trainer, your career aspirations and personal growth are directly supported through the focus on developing your service knowledge, delivering your purpose, and creating an environment where you can succeed.  Back to Search Results Personal Trainer – Upper West Side Overview OUR STORY Equinox Group is a high-growth collective of the world’s most influential, experiential and differentiated lifestyle brands that includes Equinox, SoulCycle, Blink Fitness, Pure Yoga, and Equinox Hotels. We have locations across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, & Vancouver. OUR CODE We are passionate about high-performance living and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a disruptive approach to unleash it. We dream big and don’t settle for the status quo. We sweat the details. We never accept less than 110% to help each other deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are inspired by our leaders and fueled by the energy and passion of our team members and we are committed to living out our values. Job Description We are passionate about what we do, and improving lives through health and fitness is our mission.The Personal Trainer position at Equinox is an opportunity for you to orchestrate your own success and create an environment that will lead you to creative financial freedom, personal autonomy, and endless development in your craft. As an Equinox Personal Trainer, you will develop your career through safe, progressive and effective programming that fits the goals, needs, and abilities of your clients, as well as create a long-term client relationship. Responsibilities include: ● Conducting fitness assessments and personal training sessions ● Maximizing member retention by engaging them with your knowledge and enthusiasm ● Facilitating overall client development through interactions, communication, and measurement of progress. ● Provide scheduled fitness and personal training sessions to members ● Participating in our educational seminars and programs

770a0e41-3174-488d-8123-79ce69467f65.description: We are hiring experienced fitness instructors to teach chair yoga, seated exercise, dance, and Tai Chi for seniors at various retirement and healthcare settings across the US! **Responsibilities** include teaching multiple types of fitness classes, being autonomous, nurturing, and maintaining a positive attitude. The job involves a mix of teaching, client interaction, and adapting to senior clients' needs.

f0ee149a-2a41-4f79-af7e-d1f110b81549.description: Join Performance Optimal Health as a Group Fitness Manager. Here at Performance, we take a holistic approach to health and recovery, ultimately striving to empower all clients to live better lives. Each of our clients undergo a unique Optimal Health Assessment, allowing us to tailor their plan of care to their specific needs using a variety of our services. Our services we offer are based upon the Four Pillars of Optimal Health – exercise, nutrition, recovery, and stress management. We have highly trained professionals in all four pillars, who make the clients journey their priority. Performance Optimal Health provides top quality care to our clients, and we would not be able to do so without our highly trained team of individuals. Come join us on our journey!
f0ee149a-2a41-4f79-af7e-d1f110b81549.title: Group Fitness Manager
f0ee149a-2a41-4f79-af7e-d1f110b81549.companyOverview: Performance Optimal Health offers a holistic approach to health, focusing on exercise, nutrition, recovery, and stress management.

jobSpecificTasks: Design personalized fitness programs for clients

a76e2357-230b-459d-a669-6a53b1f4d389.description: Responsibilities: - Design and implement personalized fitness programs for clients based on their goals, abilities, and preferences - Conduct one-on-one personal training sessions to guide and motivate clients through their workouts - Provide education on proper exercise techniques, body mechanics, and injury prevention - Monitor and track clients' progress, adjusting programs as needed to ensure continued improvement - Offer nutritional guidance and advice to support clients' overall health and wellness goals - Lead group fitness classes and provide instruction on proper form and technique - Assist with fitness sales by promoting services, conducting consultations, and signing up new clients - Provide sports coaching and training for individuals or teams as needed
